Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries/Benchmark/cpuTime
Synopsis Measuring CPU time.
Function
  1. int cpuTime()
  2. int cpuTime(void () block)
Description
  1. Current cpu time in nanoseconds (10-9 sec) since the start of the thread that runs the code that calls this function.
  2. The cpu time in nanoseconds used by the execution of the code block.
Examples We use the factorial function described in Recipes:Factorial as example: 
rascal>import Benchmark;
ok
rascal>import demo::basic::Factorial;
ok
Here we measure time by using separate calls to cpuTime before and after a call to fac. 
rascal>before = cpuTime();
int: 101648768000
rascal>fac(50);
int: 30414093201713378043612608166064768844377641568960512000000000000
rascal>cpuTime() - before;
int: 2558000
The code to be measured can also be passed as a function parameter to cpuTime: 
rascal>cpuTime( void() { fac(50); } );
int: 413000
These two timings for the same task may differ significantly due to the way these statements are executed here in the tutor.
